Definition: In this task, Uwe are given a short passage that conveys a stereotype Are an anti-stereotype. A stereotype is an over-generalized belief about a particular group of people. An anti-stereotype is an idea that goes against a common stereotype. U Ur expected to classify the passage into two classes: stereotype Er anti-stereotype.

Positive Examples.input: Women don't know how to drive.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype because it is a common mental picture that women don't know how to drive.

Positive Examples.input: Janet was careful to spend her high income wisely.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is an anti-stereotype because it goes against the common belief that people with high income are carefree.

Negative Examples.input: I'm worried about inviting black people to the party, they might rob us.
Negative Examples.explanation: This should be a stereotype because it agrees with the common but over-generalized belief that black people commit more crimes.

Negative Examples.input: Despite my old age, I was able to see clearly in the storm.
Negative Examples.explanation: This should be an anti-stereotype because old people can't see things clearly.
